snippet: The Winter Olympics, whose opening ceremony began on Friday, represents a chance for President Vladimir V. Putin to demonstrate his mastery of the global levers of power, even if the cost of hosting the competition has added to economic anxiety.
abstract: Russian Pres Vladimir V Putin and his allies view Winter Olympics in Sochi as proof of country's emergence from ruins of Soviet Union and arrival on global stage; others, however, fear that $50 billion spent on Games will further weaken already faltering economy.

byline.contributor: Patrick Reevell contributed reporting from Moscow, and Nikolay Khalip from Sochi, Russia.

lead_paragraph: The Winter Olympics, whose opening ceremony began on Friday, represents a chance for President Vladimir V. Putin to demonstrate his mastery of the global levers of power, even if the cost of hosting the competition has added to economic anxiety.

headline.main: A Triumph for Putin, if Not for the Rest of a Sagging Russia
headline.print_headline: As Putin Sees a Triumph, Russia Faces a Downturn
